title: Track Awesome Micro Npm Packages Updates Weekly

items.summary: 3 awesome projects updated on Oct 05 - Oct 11, 2020
items.content_text:
### Modules / Math

*   [my-prime (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/jinnatul/my-prime) - A good way to tell if a number is prime or not.
*   [fun-gcd (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/zubayerhimel/fun-gcd) - A tiny math library to get gcd of two numbers using Euclidean algorithm

### Modules / Other

*   [mime-type-check (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/RocktimSaikia/mime-type-check) - Get the MIME type of a file by its extension.
items.content_html:
Modules / Math

  • my-prime (‚≠ê2) - A good way to tell if a number is prime or not.
  • fun-gcd (‚≠ê1) - A tiny math library to get gcd of two numbers using Euclidean algorithm

Modules / Other

  • mime-type-check (‚≠ê5) - Get the MIME type of a file by its extension.

items.title: Awesome Micro Npm Packages Updates on Aug 24 - Aug 30, 2020
items.summary: 3 awesome projects updated on Aug 24 - Aug 30, 2020
items.content_text:
### Modules / Math

*   [is-even (‚≠ê239)](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/is-even) - A good way to tell if a number is even or not (avoids type issues). Uses `is-odd` and `is-number` under the hood.
*   [is-odd (‚≠ê344)](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/is-odd) - A good way to tell if a number is odd or not (avoids type issues). Uses `is-number` under the hood.
*   [easy-math.js (‚≠ê7)](https://github.com/kingzez/easy-math.js) - A tiny easy math library including addition, multiplication, subtraction, and division.
items.content_html:
Modules / Math

  • is-even (‚≠ê239) - A good way to tell if a number is even or not (avoids type issues). Uses is-odd and is-number under the hood.
  • is-odd (‚≠ê344) - A good way to tell if a number is odd or not (avoids type issues). Uses is-number under the hood.
  • easy-math.js (‚≠ê7) - A tiny easy math library including addition, multiplication, subtraction, and division.

items.title: Awesome Micro Npm Packages Updates on Oct 23 - Oct 29, 2017
items.summary: 2 awesome projects updated on Oct 23 - Oct 29, 2017
items.content_text:
### Modules / Object

*   [merge-objects (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/shevaroller/node-merge-objects) - Deep-merge two objects. Arrays that are values of the same object key get concatenated.
*   [deep-object-diff (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/mattphillips/deep-object-diff) - Deep diff two JavaScript Objects while preserving the data structure. Including nested structures of Arrays and Objects.
items.content_html:
Modules / Object

  • merge-objects (‚≠ê2) - Deep-merge two objects. Arrays that are values of the same object key get concatenated.
  • deep-object-diff (‚≠ê1.1k) - Deep diff two JavaScript Objects while preserving the data structure. Including nested structures of Arrays and Objects.

items.title: Awesome Micro Npm Packages Updates on Jul 18 - Jul 24, 2016
items.summary: 6 awesome projects updated on Jul 18 - Jul 24, 2016
items.content_text: ### Modules / String * [rtrim (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/sergejmueller/rtrim) - Strip whitespace - or other characters - from the end of a string. ### Modules / Object * [missing-deep-keys (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/vladgolubev/missing-deep-keys) - Returns an array of keys from first object that are missing in second. * [has-own-property (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/LinusU/has-own-property) - Check if an object has a local property. ### Modules / Browser * [image-promise (‚≠ê147)](https://github.com/bfred-it/image-promise) - Load one or more ``s in a Promise. * [get-media-size (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/bfred-it/get-media-size) - Get the original size of any `img`/`video`/`svg`/`canvas` tags or canvas context. ### Modules / CLI * [minimist](https://github.com/substack/minimist) - Parse argument options.
items.content_html:
Modules / String

  • rtrim (‚≠ê0) - Strip whitespace - or other characters - from the end of a string.

Modules / Object

  • missing-deep-keys (‚≠ê0) - Returns an array of keys from first object that are missing in second.
  • has-own-property (‚≠ê3) - Check if an object has a local property.

Modules / Browser

  • image-promise (‚≠ê147) - Load one or more <img>s in a Promise.
  • get-media-size (‚≠ê12) - Get the original size of any img/video/svg/canvas tags or canvas context.

Modules / CLI

  • minimist - Parse argument options.

  • pump (‚≠ê913) - pipe streams together and close all of them if one of them closes.

Modules / Other

  • is-fqdn (‚≠ê21) - Check if a string represent a fully qualified domain name.

items.title: Awesome Micro Npm Packages Updates on Mar 21 - Mar 27, 2016
items.summary: 5 awesome projects updated on Mar 21 - Mar 27, 2016
items.content_text:
### Modules / Array

*   [in-array (‚≠ê16)](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/in-array) - Return true if any of passed values exists in array - faster than using indexOf.

### Modules / String

*   [pad-left (‚≠ê44)](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/pad-left) - Left pad a string with zeros or a specified string.

### Modules / Promise

*   [sleep-promise (‚≠ê87)](https://github.com/brummelte/sleep-promise) - Resolves a promise after a specified delay.
*   [is-promise (‚≠ê281)](https://github.com/then/is-promise) - Test whether an object looks like a promises-a+ promise.

### Modules / Generators

*   [is-generator (‚≠ê15)](https://github.com/blakeembrey/is-generator) - Check whether a given value is a generator function.
items.content_html:
Modules / Array

  • in-array (‚≠ê16) - Return true if any of passed values exists in array - faster than using indexOf.

Modules / String

  • pad-left (‚≠ê44) - Left pad a string with zeros or a specified string.

Modules / Promise

  • sleep-promise (‚≠ê87) - Resolves a promise after a specified delay.
  • is-promise (‚≠ê281) - Test whether an object looks like a promises-a+ promise.

Modules / Generators

  • is-generator (‚≠ê15) - Check whether a given value is a generator function.

items.title: Awesome Micro Npm Packages Updates on Feb 29 - Mar 06, 2016
items.summary: 4 awesome projects updated on Feb 29 - Mar 06, 2016
items.content_text:
### Modules / Date & Time

*   [akamai-time-reference (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/jucrouzet/akamai-time-reference) - Get reference time using Akamai's time reference service.

### Modules / Object

*   [has-key-deep (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/ryanaghdam/has-key-deep) - Deep-search objects for keys. Keys can be searched by providing an array of keys, or using a dot-notiation.

### Modules / Math

*   [is-number (‚≠ê277)](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/is-number) - Returns `true` if the value is a number.

### Modules / Promise

*   [promise-all-props (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/Siilwyn/promise-all-props) - Like `Promise.all` but for object properties.
items.content_html:
Modules / Date & Time

  • akamai-time-reference (‚≠ê3) - Get reference time using Akamai's time reference service.

Modules / Object

  • has-key-deep (‚≠ê1) - Deep-search objects for keys. Keys can be searched by providing an array of keys, or using a dot-notiation.

Modules / Math

  • is-number (‚≠ê277) - Returns true if the value is a number.

Modules / Promise

  • promise-all-props (‚≠ê9) - Like Promise.all but for object properties.

items.title: Awesome Micro Npm Packages Updates on Feb 22 - Feb 28, 2016
items.summary: 9 awesome projects updated on Feb 22 - Feb 28, 2016
items.content_text:
### Modules / Date & Time

*   [fecha (‚≠ê2.1k)](https://github.com/taylorhakes/fecha) - Javascript Date formatting and parsing.

### Modules / Object

*   [has-value (‚≠ê26)](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/has-value) - Returns true if a value exists, false if empty. Works with deeply nested values using dot notation (`'a.b.c'`) paths.
*   [stringify-object (‚≠ê315)](https://github.com/yeoman/stringify-object) - Stringify an object/array like JSON.stringify just without all the double-quotes.

### Modules / File System

*   [du (‚≠ê28)](https://github.com/rvagg/node-du) - A simple JavaScript implementation of du -sb.
*   [file-size (‚≠ê232)](https://github.com/Nijikokun/file-size) - Lightweight filesize to human-readable / proportions w/o dependencies.
*   [tmp (‚≠ê754)](https://github.com/raszi/node-tmp) - Temporary file and directory creator for node.js.
*   [fs-promise (‚≠ê170)](https://github.com/kevinbeaty/fs-promise) - Node fs methods as Promise/A+ (optional fs-extra, graceful-fs).

### Modules / Browser

*   [dom-element-value (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/crysalead-js/dom-element-value) - DOM element value getter/setter.

### Modules / CLI

*   [username (‚≠ê143)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/username) - Get the username of the current user.
items.content_html:
Modules / Date & Time

  • fecha (‚≠ê2.1k) - Javascript Date formatting and parsing.

Modules / Object

  • has-value (‚≠ê26) - Returns true if a value exists, false if empty. Works with deeply nested values using dot notation ('a.b.c') paths.
  • stringify-object (‚≠ê315) - Stringify an object/array like JSON.stringify just without all the double-quotes.

Modules / File System

  • du (‚≠ê28) - A simple JavaScript implementation of du -sb.
  • file-size (‚≠ê232) - Lightweight filesize to human-readable / proportions w/o dependencies.
  • tmp (‚≠ê754) - Temporary file and directory creator for node.js.
  • fs-promise (‚≠ê170) - Node fs methods as Promise/A+ (optional fs-extra, graceful-fs).

Modules / Browser

  • dom-element-value (‚≠ê6) - DOM element value getter/setter.

Modules / CLI

  • username (‚≠ê143) - Get the username of the current user.

items.title: Awesome Micro Npm Packages Updates on Feb 15 - Feb 21, 2016
items.summary: 7 awesome projects updated on Feb 15 - Feb 21, 2016
items.content_text:
### Modules / Date & Time

*   [periods (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/timruffles/periods) - Defined time-periods constants for Javascript, in milliseconds.

### Modules / Object

*   [is-empty-object (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/gummesson/is-empty-object) - Check if an object is empty.

### Modules / Semver

*   [semver-first-satisfied (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/parro-it/semver-first-satisfied) - Find minimum in an array of version that satisfies a semver range.

### Modules / CLI

*   [abbrev (‚≠ê167)](https://github.com/isaacs/abbrev-js) - Calculate the set of unique abbreviations for a given set of strings.
*   [glob (‚≠ê8.6k)](https://github.com/isaacs/node-glob) - Glob functionality for node.js.

### Modules / Module management

*   [pkg-conf (‚≠ê121)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/pkg-conf) - Get namespaced config from the closest package.json.
*   [normalize-pkg (‚≠ê18)](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/normalize-pkg) - Normalize values in package.json to improve compatibility, programmatic readability and usefulness with third party libs.
items.content_html:
Modules / Date & Time

  • periods (‚≠ê1) - Defined time-periods constants for Javascript, in milliseconds.

Modules / Object

  • is-empty-object (‚≠ê11) - Check if an object is empty.

Modules / Semver

  • semver-first-satisfied (‚≠ê2) - Find minimum in an array of version that satisfies a semver range.

Modules / CLI

  • abbrev (‚≠ê167) - Calculate the set of unique abbreviations for a given set of strings.
  • glob (‚≠ê8.6k) - Glob functionality for node.js.

Modules / Module management

  • pkg-conf (‚≠ê121) - Get namespaced config from the closest package.json.
  • normalize-pkg (‚≠ê18) - Normalize values in package.json to improve compatibility, programmatic readability and usefulness with third party libs.

items.title: Awesome Micro Npm Packages Updates on Feb 08 - Feb 14, 2016
items.summary: 6 awesome projects updated on Feb 08 - Feb 14, 2016
items.content_text:
### Articles

*   [Evaluating Packages Part 1 - Turn to community](http://bytearcher.com/articles/evaluating-packages-1-check-community/)
*   [Evaluating Packages Part 2 - Review repository](http://bytearcher.com/articles/evaluating-packages-2-review-repository/)

### Modules / Array

*   [map-array (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/parro-it/map-array) - Map object keys and values into an array.

### Modules / Object

*   [flatten-obj (‚≠ê21)](https://github.com/watson/flatten-obj) - Converts an object literal with deeply nested nodes to a simple key/value object.

### Modules / Function

*   [identity-function](https://github.com/substack/identity-function) - Always return the input argument.
*   [mem (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/mem) - An optimization technique used to speed up consecutive function calls by caching the result of calls with identical input.
items.content_html:
Articles

  • Evaluating Packages Part 1 - Turn to community
  • Evaluating Packages Part 2 - Review repository

Modules / Array

  • map-array (‚≠ê4) - Map object keys and values into an array.

Modules / Object

  • flatten-obj (‚≠ê21) - Converts an object literal with deeply nested nodes to a simple key/value object.

Modules / Function

  • identity-function - Always return the input argument.
  • mem (‚≠ê1.1k) - An optimization technique used to speed up consecutive function calls by caching the result of calls with identical input.

items.title: Awesome Micro Npm Packages Updates on Feb 01 - Feb 07, 2016
items.summary: 52 awesome projects updated on Feb 01 - Feb 07, 2016
items.content_text:
### Articles

*   [One-line node modules (‚≠ê143)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/ama/issues/10)
*   [Module best practices (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/mattdesl/module-best-practices)

### Modules / Array

*   [is-sorted (‚≠ê23)](https://github.com/dcousens/is-sorted) - A small module to check if an Array is sorted.
*   [array-first (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/array-first) - Get the first element or first n elements of an array.
*   [array-last (‚≠ê35)](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/array-last) - Return the last element in an array.
*   [arr-flatten (‚≠ê59)](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/arr-flatten) - Recursively flatten an array or arrays.
*   [dedupe (‚≠ê24)](https://github.com/seriousManual/dedupe) - Remove duplicates from an array.
*   [array-range (‚≠ê25)](https://github.com/mattdesl/array-range) - Creates a new array with given range.
*   [arr-diff (‚≠ê47)](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/arr-diff) - Returns an array with only the unique values from the first array, by excluding all values from additional arrays using strict equality for comparisons.
*   [filled-array (‚≠ê42)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/filled-array) - Returns an array filled with the specified input

### Modules / String

*   [decamelize (‚≠ê239)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/decamelize) - Convert a camelized string into a lowercased one with a custom separator: unicornRainbow ‚Üí unicorn\_rainbow.
*   [to-camel-case (‚≠ê35)](https://github.com/ianstormtaylor/to-camel-case) - Convert a string to a camel case.
*   [to-capital-case (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/ianstormtaylor/to-capital-case) - Convert a string to a capital case.
*   [to-constant-case (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/ianstormtaylor/to-constant-case) - Convert a string to a constant case.
*   [to-dot-case (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/ianstormtaylor/to-dot-case) - Convert a string to a dot case.
*   [to-no-case (‚≠ê16)](https://github.com/ianstormtaylor/to-no-case) - Remove an existing case from a string.
*   [to-pascal-case (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/ianstormtaylor/to-pascal-case) - Convert a string to a pascal case.
*   [to-sentence-case (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/ianstormtaylor/to-sentence-case) - Convert a string to a sentence case.
*   [to-snake-case (‚≠ê26)](https://github.com/ianstormtaylor/to-snake-case) - Convert a string to a snake case.
*   [to-space-case (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/ianstormtaylor/to-space-case) - Convert a string to a space case.
*   [to-title-case (‚≠ê18)](https://github.com/ianstormtaylor/to-title-case) - Convert a string to a title case.

### Modules / Date & Time

*   [pretty-ms (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/pretty-ms) - Convert milliseconds to a human readable string: 1337000000 ‚Üí 15d 11h 23m 20s.
*   [hirestime (‚≠ê17)](https://github.com/seriousManual/hirestime) - A wrapper around the built-in high resolution timer which simplifies the calculation of timestamps.

### Modules / Object

*   [map-obj (‚≠ê213)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/map-obj) - Map object keys and values into a new object.
*   [filter-obj (‚≠ê102)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/filter-obj) - Filter object keys and values into a new object.
*   [object-values (‚≠ê26)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/object-values) - Get the values of an object.
*   [object-pairs (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/eush77/object-pairs) - Turn an object into list of \[key, value] pairs for mapping, iterating or other purposes.
*   [zipmap (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/landau/zipmap) - Returns a map with the keys mapped to the corresponding vals. zipmap also accepts a single value of objects or pairs.
*   [just-pluck (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/jarofghosts/just-pluck) - Pluck without the madness.
*   [deep-equal (‚≠ê792)](https://github.com/substack/node-deep-equal) - Node's assert.deepEqual() algorithm as a standalone module.
*   [deep-assign (‚≠ê247)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/deep-assign) - Recursive Object.assign().
*   [set-value (‚≠ê278)](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value) - Create nested values and any intermediaries dot notation (`'a.b.c'`) paths.
*   [get-value (‚≠ê288)](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/get-value) - Use property paths (a.b.c) to get a nested value from an object.
*   [flatkeys (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/ricardobeat/flatkeys) - Flatten object key hierarchies into a list of strings using a custom separator.

### Modules / Function

*   [curry (‚≠ê316)](https://github.com/dominictarr/curry) - A curry function without anything too clever.
*   [once (‚≠ê222)](https://github.com/isaacs/once) - Run a function exactly one time.
*   [deep-bind (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/deep-bind) - Bind a context to all functions in an object, including deeply nested functions.

### Modules / Stream

*   [through2 (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/rvagg/through2) - Tiny wrapper around Node streams2 Transform to avoid explicit subclassing noise.
*   [through2-filter (‚≠ê35)](https://github.com/brycebaril/through2-filter) - A through2 to create an Array.prototype.filter analog for streams.
*   [through2-map (‚≠ê70)](https://github.com/brycebaril/through2-map) - A through2 to create an Array.prototype.map analog for streams.
*   [stream-spigot (‚≠ê15)](https://github.com/brycebaril/node-stream-spigot) - A readable stream generator, useful for testing or converting simple functions into Readable streams.
*   [concat-stream (‚≠ê577)](https://github.com/maxogden/concat-stream) - writable stream that concatenates strings or data and calls a callback with the result.
*   [JSONStream (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/dominictarr/JSONStream) - streaming JSON.parse and stringify

### Modules / File System

*   [rimraf (‚≠ê5.8k)](https://github.com/isaacs/rimraf) - A deep deletion module for node (like rm -rf).
*   [mkdirp](https://github.com/substack/node-mkdirp) - Recursively mkdir, like mkdir -p.

### Modules / Browser

*   [delegate (‚≠ê184)](https://github.com/zenorocha/delegate) - Lightweight event delegation.
*   [insert-css](https://github.com/substack/insert-css) - Insert a string of css into the head

### Modules / Semver

*   [semver (‚≠ê5.3k)](https://github.com/npm/node-semver) - The semantic version parser used by npm.
*   [semver-max (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/eush77/semver-max) - Find maximum (or minimum) version according to semver.

### Modules / Other

*   [node-mime (‚≠ê2.3k)](https://github.com/broofa/node-mime) - Comprehensive MIME type mapping API based on mime-db module.

### Related lists / Tools

*   [awesome-nodejs (‚≠ê62k)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/awesome-nodejs) - A curated list of delightful Node.js packages and resources.
*   [awesome-npm (‚≠ê4.6k)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/awesome-npm) - Awesome npm resources and tips.
items.content_html:
Articles

  • One-line node modules (‚≠ê143)
  • Module best practices (‚≠ê1.6k)

Modules / Array

  • is-sorted (‚≠ê23) - A small module to check if an Array is sorted.
  • array-first (‚≠ê11) - Get the first element or first n elements of an array.
  • array-last (‚≠ê35) - Return the last element in an array.
  • arr-flatten (‚≠ê59) - Recursively flatten an array or arrays.
  • dedupe (‚≠ê24) - Remove duplicates from an array.
  • array-range (‚≠ê25) - Creates a new array with given range.
  • arr-diff (‚≠ê47) - Returns an array with only the unique values from the first array, by excluding all values from additional arrays using strict equality for comparisons.
  • filled-array (‚≠ê42) - Returns an array filled with the specified input

Modules / String

  • decamelize (‚≠ê239) - Convert a camelized string into a lowercased one with a custom separator: unicornRainbow ‚Üí unicorn_rainbow.
  • to-camel-case (‚≠ê35) - Convert a string to a camel case.
  • to-capital-case (‚≠ê11) - Convert a string to a capital case.
  • to-constant-case (‚≠ê4) - Convert a string to a constant case.
  • to-dot-case (‚≠ê5) - Convert a string to a dot case.
  • to-no-case (‚≠ê16) - Remove an existing case from a string.
  • to-pascal-case (‚≠ê3) - Convert a string to a pascal case.
  • to-sentence-case (‚≠ê6) - Convert a string to a sentence case.
  • to-snake-case (‚≠ê26) - Convert a string to a snake case.
  • to-space-case (‚≠ê6) - Convert a string to a space case.
  • to-title-case (‚≠ê18) - Convert a string to a title case.

Modules / Date & Time

  • pretty-ms (‚≠ê1.2k) - Convert milliseconds to a human readable string: 1337000000 ‚Üí 15d 11h 23m 20s.
  • hirestime (‚≠ê17) - A wrapper around the built-in high resolution timer which simplifies the calculation of timestamps.

Modules / Object

  • map-obj (‚≠ê213) - Map object keys and values into a new object.
  • filter-obj (‚≠ê102) - Filter object keys and values into a new object.
  • object-values (‚≠ê26) - Get the values of an object.
  • object-pairs (‚≠ê2) - Turn an object into list of [key, value] pairs for mapping, iterating or other purposes.
  • zipmap (‚≠ê4) - Returns a map with the keys mapped to the corresponding vals. zipmap also accepts a single value of objects or pairs.
  • just-pluck (‚≠ê11) - Pluck without the madness.
  • deep-equal (‚≠ê792) - Node's assert.deepEqual() algorithm as a standalone module.
  • deep-assign (‚≠ê247) - Recursive Object.assign().
  • set-value (‚≠ê278) - Create nested values and any intermediaries dot notation ('a.b.c') paths.
  • get-value (‚≠ê288) - Use property paths (a.b.c) to get a nested value from an object.
  • flatkeys (‚≠ê3) - Flatten object key hierarchies into a list of strings using a custom separator.

Modules / Function

  • curry (‚≠ê316) - A curry function without anything too clever.
  • once (‚≠ê222) - Run a function exactly one time.
  • deep-bind (‚≠ê9) - Bind a context to all functions in an object, including deeply nested functions.

Modules / Stream

  • through2 (‚≠ê1.9k) - Tiny wrapper around Node streams2 Transform to avoid explicit subclassing noise.
  • through2-filter (‚≠ê35) - A through2 to create an Array.prototype.filter analog for streams.
  • through2-map (‚≠ê70) - A through2 to create an Array.prototype.map analog for streams.
  • stream-spigot (‚≠ê15) - A readable stream generator, useful for testing or converting simple functions into Readable streams.
  • concat-stream (‚≠ê577) - writable stream that concatenates strings or data and calls a callback with the result.
  • JSONStream (‚≠ê1.9k) - streaming JSON.parse and stringify

Modules / File System

  • rimraf (‚≠ê5.8k) - A deep deletion module for node (like rm -rf).
  • mkdirp - Recursively mkdir, like mkdir -p.

Modules / Browser

  • delegate (‚≠ê184) - Lightweight event delegation.
  • insert-css - Insert a string of css into the head

Modules / Semver

  • semver (‚≠ê5.3k) - The semantic version parser used by npm.
  • semver-max (‚≠ê3) - Find maximum (or minimum) version according to semver.

Modules / Other

  • node-mime (‚≠ê2.3k) - Comprehensive MIME type mapping API based on mime-db module.

Related lists / Tools

  • awesome-nodejs (‚≠ê62k) - A curated list of delightful Node.js packages and resources.
  • awesome-npm (‚≠ê4.6k) - Awesome npm resources and tips.
